thread.title: Ronaldo Gets Record Fourth Golden Boot
thread.title_full: Ronaldo Gets Record Fourth Golden Boot

title: Ronaldo Gets Record Fourth Golden Boot
text:
Ronaldo Gets Record Fourth Golden Boot 13:38, UK, Tuesday 13 October 2015 Share by email Cristiano Ronaldo has received a record fourth Golden Boot award after scoring the most goals across Europe's domestic leagues last season. 
He scored 48 goals in 35 Spanish league games to claim his third Golden Boot playing for Real Madrid. 
The Portuguese forward's other award came with Manchester United in the 2007-08 season. 
No other player has won four Golden Boots. 
Ronaldo received his award from Real president Florentino Perez. He was accompanied at the gala by his mother, his son, Madrid coach Rafa Benitez and the Portuguese ambassador to Spain. 
The 30-year-old became Real Madrid's all-time leading scorer on 30 September with 324 goals, surpassing the previous 323 tally set by Raul Gonzalez. Raul now plays for New York Cosmos. Promoted Stories
